intro: Azorella albovaginata var. pauciflorum, commonly known as the white-barked azorella, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to the Andes mountains of South America. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and grayish-white stems. Its leaves are typically short and densely packed, forming a dense mat. It produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring, which are clustered in umbels.
